reviewText: Fantastic series, well worth the investment. Add this to your collection. Note there is no fan service. This series has a serious approach with plenty of comedy. A very enjoyable series. Be warned, there is likely another season following this one. Funnimation needs to make sure to produce season 3 on dvd.

I love this series. I don't understand why it was cancelled. Wish they would come out with season 3. Anyway this is a great anime. Definitely worth watching. And the S.A.V.E edition is a great way to get the less popular shows out there at a lower price. Thank you Funimation. :)

D. Gray-Man is a fantastic anime about a young man named Allen Walker; who has a demon curse. Allen joins a group of exorcists that fight the Millennium Earl. The Millennium Earl is a demon who seeks to destroy the world by filling it with evil spirits. Allen Walker and his friends embark on a bloody battle to save innocent lives. D. Gray-Man is a very different series. The Gothic mixed with the supernatural creates a unique atmosphere. There are also lots of great characters, good and evil. Character development is the "bread and butter" of this anime. There are also many other awesome points: top notch animation, good soundtrack, and suspenseful action, as well as plenty of comic relief. If you are an anime fan and haven't watched this, I really want you give it a shot. It's very good.
I found this series to be awesome it does a good job of building up the characters and continues to be interesting as it goes along, I highly recommend this to any anime fan.

Which in reality, this is in of Season 1, as in Japan it goes up to episode 51 before rolling on to season 2. But anyway, to the review.
Well, clearly if you picked it up, you enjoyed Funi's season 1, so you already like it. So, I'm going to say something else. Yes, Funimation hasn't dubbed the rest, they're trying to get a hold of it, but Dentsu isn't lowing the price for the license. So, if you enjoy the series and have anime friends, tell them to buy the series, it'll help Funi get it in gear and get the rest. This series is a wonderful shonen series and it deserves to get finished.
The anime series is alrigth but suck since it finished in a point where nobody happy. Please let email funimation to dub the rest, until they do because japan have fifthy more episode.

I looooooove D.Gray-man!  It's in my top 5 favorite anime of all time.  The only downside is that the series is on hold currently and there are only two seasons (I believe the manga also is incomplete).  I believe this is due to the creator having health issues but don't quote me on that.

D.Gray-man is dark and morbid, and occasionally a little bloody, but not gory really.  There's no explicit content either so far which I tend to prefer in the media I vew.  The world is very unique and the plot will keep you glued to the screen.  There are a couple humorous episodes here and there that had me laughing from start to finish, though most of the anime is very dark and heavy in quality.

All in all I highly recommend this anime.

If you are going for buying season 2, I'm going to assume you've been watching season 1 so I don't need to explain the anime for you. The story progresses into killing many akuma and characters that you loved in the first season come back with their own side stories in the second season.
Packaging was great and this anime has become one of my favorites. Dark story, comedy, and a top notch cast of vocal actors.
I love this anime. It has action, heart, and an amazing storyline. The sad part is they didn't continue to dub the rest of the episodes. Still, you can't go wrong, especially with the S.A.V.E price.

The Story continues with your favorite Exorcist Allen Walker. The Millennium Earl is on the move with his plans to destroy the world. And it's up to the Black Order to try and stop him. Allen Walker is currently in search for his master. (who is currently missing or, just running away from his duties like always.) There are a lot more fights in this season and the enemies plan is still a mystery. I wish there was more coming out but, sadly no. I guess I have to watch online just like everyone else.

As the 2nd season continues D Gray man becomes better the story and plot improve better we see more backstory of the characters. We get even more detailed information of the innocence the exorcist order power. The Japanese and English voice actors do a great job of voicing the characters. With more battles against akuma and the Millenium Earl this series won't dissapoint in comedy action and story I highly recommend if you have seen first season and liked it and wish to see more.
For those who are interested , I learned on Funimations blog that they have acquired eps. 52-103 and they will let us know when they will be released.

It got here safely and in a timely manner. It plays well. The supplier is not the problem. It is the mislabeling placed on the product. There are 53 missing episodes for season 2. They are not included and where not subbed or dubbed. They are available online to watch but not to buy. If you buy this, keep in mind you are only getting 25  episodes. To continue watching you have to go to a site like Hulu for 52 on.
